docs.lead_paragraph: The strength acquired by rumor "eundo" is finely illustrated by the reputed illness of Hon. WILLIAM R. KING. It started from Alabama, a feeble bantling, a mere gossiping report that Mr. KING had a cold in the head, a cough, a touch of lumbago, or a twinge of rheumatism in the left shoulder.

docs.lead_paragraph: FACTS FOR THE NEXT EDITION OF UNCLE TOM'S CABIN.--There died lately, in a lower county of Virginia, a mulaon man who was manumitted by his master, and was under our law permitted to remain in Virginia. His master had with his liberty, left him a respectable property, and this man by industry accumulated an estate of $25,000.

docs.lead_paragraph: The bark Rebecca, with advices from Rio Janeiro to Oct. 24th, arrived at this port to-day. Her captain reports that at the date of his departure all was comparatively quiet.
docs.snippet: The bark Rebecca, with advices from Rio Janeiro to Oct. 24th, arrived at this port to-day. Her captain reports that at the date of his departure all was comparatively quiet.

headline.main: How Mrs. Doleful Became a Happy Woman.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Doleful was what the world calls a fine lady. She resided in yon magnificent and most costly furnished four-story freestone dwelling; and was supposed to be favored far beyond most people of her acquaintance, with this world's goods ;--indeed, people did say that they knew of no one who made a more dashing appearance with their fine horses and carriage, costly equipage and livery servants, than did Mrs. Doleful.

headline.main: POLITICAL DOCUMENTS.; VIRGINIA AND THE NEXT ADMINISTRATION. Great Democratic Festival at Richmond.

docs.lead_paragraph: A great Democratic Festival was held at Richmond, Va., on the 1st inst., in honor of the election of General PIERCE to the Presidency. At the dinner, the following letters were read from invited guests who were unable to attend; we copy them as indicative of the views entertained in influential quarters, concerning the character of the contest just closed:

docs.lead_paragraph: A description of Antioch College, of which Institution Hon. HORACE MANN has been Chair President, is given by a correspondent of the National Era: Antioch College is the name of an Institution established in Yellow Springs. Greene Co.. Ohio, by the religious body called the "Christian Connection."

docs.lead_paragraph: From Dickens's Household Words. Having received permission from the Tuscan Secretary of State to visit the MADIAI in the prisons where they are severally expiating their enormous crime of possessing a Bible, we determined to take the husband first in order, for, by a refinement of cruelty, they are confined in separable prisons, in different parts of the country.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE VICE-PRESIDENT ELECT.--A meeting of the personal friends and neighbors of Hon. WILLIAM R KING, was held in the town of Selina, Ala., for the purpose of tendering to him some public expression of their feelings of regard and confidence. A letter was accordingly sent to him, inviting him to a public dinner, to which he returned the following reply: PINE HILLS, Dallas Co., NOV. 19, 1852.

headline.main: Mr. Faulkner and the Cuban Papers.
WASHINGTON.; Preparations for the Winter Campaign-Claims before Congress--The Administration and Cuban Affairs, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the hurricane is preceded by an hour of significant quiet and repose, so Washington, during the few days just before the meeting of Congress, is excessively dull and stupid, so far as relates to the discussion or development of political affairs. The present is the hour of preparation; the storm breaks on Monday next--and a considerable of a shower is generally anticipated, for the three months to come.
docs.snippet: As the hurricane is preceded by an hour of significant quiet and repose, so Washington, during the few days just before the meeting of Congress, is excessively dull and stupid, so far as relates to the discussion or development of political affairs....
